Dear Cantera users,

For those interested in developing hydrocarbon oxidati=
on mechanisms
(principle emphasis, at the moment), the webREACTION mechanis=
m
generation software is being made available for  those who want to try
it=
 out. The main mechanism output format is in CHEMKIN, but there is a
capabi=
lity built in that uses Cantera to run zero dimensional
simulations (BTW, I=
f I am violating any licensing please tell me) --
hence, one of the reasons=
 for posting here (I am not 100% satisfied with
how the time-stepping funct=
ions, but it is a first attempt). 

At the moment, what is downloaded is a =
JAVA client (I've tried it under
both windows and LINUX) which accesses a s=
erver on the web (the REACTION
system executable).  Eventually, I think, th=
e software (a mixture of C,
C++, JAVA and web-services) will be available i=
n some sort of public
domain licensing, but I have to figure out how (and w=
hat type of
license) and to clean up the packaging and porting of the code,=
 so this
may take some time.

This is a preliminary release to test it and =
to generate interest. The
information on the http://esblurock.info  website=
 will be updated
frequently in the coming weeks. For those interested in up=
dates are
invited to register at the site.

The software was used in the re=
cent publication in Combustion Science
and Technology paper:
AUTOMATIC GENE=
RATION OF A DETAILED MECHANISM FOR THE OXIDATION OF
n-DECANE, GLADYS MOR=C3=
=89AC, EDWARD S. BLUROCK, FABIAN MAUSS
( http://journalsonline.tandf.co.uk/=
link.asp?id=3Dm68h44n6m1jx70w0 )
To download the webREACTION client availab=
le at:
http://esblurock.info/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=
=3D30&Itemid=3D26
There are also flash tutorial demonstrations of the softw=
are available
at:
http://esblurock.info/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&task=
=3Dcategory&sectionid=3D5&id=3D30&Itemid=3D47

For more information, you ca=
n contact me:
Edward S. Blurock
http://esblurock.info
edward.blurock@esblur=
ock.info
